column4: Hello all! I'm having a problem when im installing Ubuntu. When it comes to choose partition, I can't find any partition. Anyone got a clue what's going on?
What setup are you starting with on the machine?
ehm, if i got that question right, i think the answer is "default" (?)
Sorry, let's see if I can clarify.  Is there any operating system installed on this machine already?  Do you intend to keep it as well if so?
Yes, i installed winxp just a couple of minutes ago. And i intend to keep it until i get used to Ubuntu.
Okay.  First, if you haven't already, please read https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DualBootHowTo - very helpful.
will do that
What you'll need to do is a little bit scary, just because of wording and the like.  You need to shrink down the one existing partition, and then create another for Ubuntu out of the free space.
Okej, I already got a swap and ext3 partitions. Do i have to "remake" them?
Nope, just select them and assign mountpoints.  ("Use as ...(swap, / )")
Do i have to do that in the installation, where im suposed to pick an partition?
Yeah, in the part about "Manually edit partition table", you'll choose each partition, and assign the appropriate "Use as ..." from a list.
well, that's the problem. When i get to that part, i cant find any partitions
But you can in what, a live session?
When i tried live, my computer just locked and i did'nt get anywhere. So i really dont know.
Okay, what's behind your statement that you already have a swap and ext3?
I used "Acronis PartitionExpert" to make a swap and ext3.
Never even heard of it...  Does the installer at least recognize that there's an ntfs partition there?
No
So it says what, all free space, or no disk at all?
no disk at all, cant see anything

Okay, sorry but that goes beyond the scope of what I'm comfortable trying to troubleshoot.  Stick around for a while and say it just like that every 15 minutes or so, "installer can't find a hard disk" or the like, and hopefully someone can help you soon.
Ok, thanks for your help anyway. Better than nothing ;)
Good luck.
